basics.name: Curt Howard
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: A highly adaptable and self-aware software engineer with over 20 years of experience building scalable, high-performance mobile and web applications. My passion lies in driving product innovation and engineering team efficiency, with a focus on clear communication and low-ego collaboration.

work.name: Convictional
work.summary: Became the head of UI/UX Development with a focus on engineering productivity to ensure product feature development was maximally efficient.
highlights: Architected the frontend of the product
Mentored others through code review and documentation
Developed and maintained an in-house component library

work.name: Tophatter
work.summary: Built a gamified shopping experience for a popular auction mobile application.

work.name: Workarea
work.summary: Built and managed many high-profile commerce websites before building a high performance, open source commerce platform.
highlights: Cultivated feedback loops with platform implementors

work.name: I-SITE
work.summary: Built and managed many non-profit mobile and web applications rapidly on a very small team.

work.name: Pepperlillie
work.summary: Built and managed beautifully designed small-to-medium sized boutique websites in this entrepreneurial partnership.
highlights: Became part owner of the company

work.name: IntuitSolutions
work.summary: Built and managed the custom storefronts of over 200 customers using eBay ProStores & BigCommerce.

work.name: Johnson & Johnson
work.summary: Converted an internal quality assurance website into the company's new content management system.

work.name: Merck
work.summary: Converted many internal department websites from ColdFusion to static HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.

volunteer.summary: Worked with the administrative team to provide maintenance for their parent portal application

references.name: Roger Kirkness (CEO @ Convictional)
references.reference: I highly recommend Curt on the basis of competence, character, detail orientation, and overall frontend engineering ability. I'm happy to provide a more detailed reference over email, and could not recommend him more highly.

projects.name: Workarea Commerce
projects.description: An enterprise-grade commerce platform written in Ruby on Rails.

projects.name: Feature.js
projects.description: Feature.js is a fast, simple and lightweight browser feature detection library.

projects.name: Wagemage
projects.description: A CLI for making changes to many GitHub-hosted git repositories.

projects.name: FauxFetus.net
projects.description: A pre-Bandcamp experimental music collective website generated entirely by ID3 audio metadata
